chapter.title: Frequently Asked Questions
chapter.para: The best way you can help make this FAQ more useful is by asking questions: either in any of the places above, or by leaving your questions in the comments below.

listitem.para: Bugs and requests for new features can be submitted to Trac
Ideas for new features can be talked about on the mailinglist

section.title: What is Red5?
section.para: Red5 is an open source Flash RTMP server written in Java that supports:

section.title: What does Red5 stand for?
section.para: Originally referenced to Star Wars.  Red5 was the "one who did the impossible".

section.title: Is there a migration guide from FMS to Red5?
section.para: Yes: Migration Guide

section.title: How do I create new applications?
What are configuration files?
section.para: see: Configuration Files In Red5

section.title: Is there a mailing list?
section.para: Check the mailing list page.

section.title: What Ports does Red5 use?
section.literallayout:
http.port=5080 // tomcat or jetty servlet container
rtmp.port=1935 // traditional rtmp
rtmpt.port=8088 // rtmp tunneled over http
mrtmp.port=9035 // used with an edge/origin setup
proxy.source_port=1936 // used to debug
section.para: These default ports can be changed in "RED5_HOME]\conf\red5.properties"
Additionally, most users only forward port 1935 and 5080

section.title: I'm interested in helping the project. How can I help?
section.para: You can create a new Trac ticket for any contributions you want to make, attach the files there or link it. Make sure you signup on the mailinglist as well..

section.title: Documentation
section.section: Can I get the documentation in PDF format? \

section.title: Where can I find the latest javadocs?
How to disable Socket policy checking for 443 (rtmps and https)?
section.para: You can change the port to something over 1024 like 8443 or comment out the RTMPS section.

section.title: How do I stream to/from custom directories?
How to detect the end of recording ?
section.para: See the API docs.

section.title: How can I record RTMP streams from Red5?
section.para: See: http://ptrthomas.wordpress.com/2008/04/19/how-to-record-rtmp-flash-video-streams-using-red5

section.title: Does Red5 support multicast streaming?
section.para: It should be noted that multicasting support is not available in the Flash Player. For that reason, no media server can deliver a multi-casting solution to the Flash Player. In addition, many networks have multicasting turned off so it may not be realiable for other platforms either such as Windows Media Player. These solutions usually fall back to unicasting when clients cannot receive muliticasted media. In regards to Unicasting, Red5 already has this functionality. In addition, we have an edge-origin solution sometimes referred to as stream-reapeating.

section.title: Can Red5 stream using UDP?
section.para: No. Even though Java can stream using UDP, the Flash Player can not receive data sent using UDP.

section.title: What is RTMFP and when will it be available in Red5?
section.para: RTMFP stands for "RTMFP (Real Time Media Flow Protocol". You can read more about it in the release notes. Just search the following page.
To understand what this protocol is and does, read the following FAQ.
Red5 does not support RTMFP. At the moment, there isn't enough exposure to RTMFP and discussion can resume once it is released and more is known about the protocol.

section.title: What databases are supported?
section.para: Red5 is built with Java. So any database that has a JDBC driver will work.

section.title: Can I use Hibernate with Red5?
What scripting languages are available?
section.para: Scripting support (JavaScript, Groovy, Beanshell, JRuby, Jython)

section.title: Does Red5 support Actionscript 1?
section.para: Not yet, but there is development in this area and proof of concepts have been presented at conferences.

section.title: Does Red5 support Actionscript 3?
section.para: Not yet, but there is development in this area and proof of concepts have viewed by Red5 team members.

section.title: Is there an IRC channel?
section.para: Yes: #red5 on irc.freenode.net
Flash non-IRC based chat: http://red5.newviewnetworks.com/iChatBar2/#

section.title: Are there any examples on the web?
section.para: Below is a list of applications that use Red5.

listitem.para: http://www.snappmx.com/ a Rapid Application Development System that supports the creation of Red5 applications.
http://www.dokeos.com videconf module by Sebastian Wagner.
http://www.weekee.tv an online video editing site by Weekee team.

http://blipback.com BlipBack is a video comment widget that you can embed on any number of social network sites or blogs you]have. Blipback lets you or your friends record short video comments directly to your page.
http://artemis.effectiveui.com Bridge AIR applications to the Java runtime.

http://jooce.com Jooce is your very own, private online desktop - with public file sharing capabilities. A highly-secure, on]ine space to keep, view, listen to - and instantly share with friends - all your files, photos,music and video.
http://facebook.com/video Video uploading/recording/messaging system that allows you to record a video on the upload page or]send a private message to another user and attach a video.

http://www.f-ab.net F-ab is a simple browser for Flash movies. F-ab has "FLVPhone", which is a video conferencing telephone ]sing the Flash movie. Red5 is embedded in F-ab to communicate with the remote FLVPhone.
Streaming video chat software script is a RED5 based system that allows you to build comprehensive pay per minute / pay per view video chat site.
http://pixelquote.com Huge Pixelwall where visitors can simply add Pixels with their Messages - by Simon Kusterer.
http://www.avchat.net Red5 Flash Audio/Video Chat Software
http://www.avchat.net/fms-bandwidth-checker.php Red5 bandwidth checker with upload/download and latency tests
http://www.nielsenaa.com/TV/tv.php Red5 Flash Php/MySql/Ajax driven scheduled & streamed multi channel TV - VOD
http://www.videoflashchat.com VideoFlashChat - Red5 version for Web Based Video Chat
http://www.videogirls.biz VideoGirls BiZ - Red5 version for Pay Per View Video Chat Software
http://www.ligachannel.com Ligachannel.com - Italian singer site. Red5 used for VOD Protected Streaming and audio/video reco]ding widgets
http://www.sticko.com/ Video portal with widgets for popular social networking sites
http://www.zingaya.jp/ VOIP server built on Red5 for Flashphone
http://www.gchats.com/red5chat/visichat/ Visichat, flash video and audio chat with red5
http://www.agileagenda.com/ The AgileAgenda web service was written with Red5
http://www.videoondemandsoftware.com RED5 based Video on demand HD-TV quality pay per view/minutes software
http://www.videochatsoftware.org Flash red5 video chat software
http://www.deltastrike.org/ DeltaStrike - free online realtime multiplayer strategy game

section.title: What Red5 groups can I join?
Why am I receiving "closing due to long handshake?

para.literal: issue: Closing RTMPMinaConnection from [IP_ADDRESS] : 2610 to [IP_ADDRESS] (in: 3415 out 3212 ), with id 512231886 due to long handshake

section.para: solution: Have you installed the example your trying to connect to? The examples are installed on demand starting with Red5 0.8. Just check the welcome page http://localhost:5080/ and look for a link that allows you to install them. After an example is installed, you should be able to run the examples.
Note: We are improving this so that if an example is chosen, it will be installed.
